clinical_study.brief_title: Bronchoscopic Closure of Bronchopleural Fistulas With Occlutech Figulla ASD N Occluder Device
clinical_study.official_title: Bronchoscopic Closure of Bronchopleural Fistulas With Occlutech Figulla ASD N Occluder Device

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of closing bronchopleural fistulas with devices originally developed for correction of cardiac septal defects deployed through bronchoscopic procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Closure of tracheobronchial fistulas with the Occlutech Figulla ASD N occluder
primary_outcome.description: The closure of the fistulas will be bronchoscopically observed at regular intervals: one week, three weeks, two months and six months. At the third months post intervention, a thorax CT scan will ascertain the correct position and stability of the device.

arm_group.description: The patients with bronchopleural fistulas treated with bronchoscopic deployment of the cardiac septal defects occluder.

intervention.intervention_name: Closure of bronchopleural fistula with Occlutech Figulla
intervention.description: Patients with bronchopleural fistulas will be submitted to a bronchoscopic procedure to deploy the cardiac septal defect occluder in the fistula traject.
intervention.other_name: Bronchoscopic bronchopleural fistula closure with occluders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 14 years old
- Bronchopleural fistulas
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical conditions increasing surgical risk (hemodynamic instability, respiratory distress)
- Immunosuppressed patients
- Acute intense inflammatory process in fistula edge
- Suppurative pleural cavity infection
